alert.note: Alert for Big Lost Highlands, Copper Basin; Frank Church Wilderness; Sawtooth, Stanley Basin; Sun Valley Region; Wood River Foothills (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 10 at 4:51PM MST until January 13 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow and strong winds possible. Snow accumulations in the valleys of 1 to 3 inches Thursday, an additional 3 to 7 inches Friday, and 5 to 10 inches Saturday. In the mountains, snow accumulations of up to 5 inches Thursday, an additional 7 to 12 inches Friday, and 10 to 20 inches Saturday. Wind gusts to 50 mph possible Friday, especially on mid and upper slopes. Winds gusts to 35 mph possible Saturday, mainly on mid and upper slopes. * WHERE...Clayton, Stanley, Ketchum, Sun Valley, Galena, Copper Basin, Hailey, Bellevue, and Picabo. * WHEN...From Thursday morning through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
